Collection.DataSetId: MODIS/Aqua Vegetation Indices 16-Day L3 Global 250m SIN Grid V006
Collection.Description:
The MYD13Q1 Version 6 product provides a Vegetation Index (VI) value at a per pixel basis. There are 2 primary vegetation layers. The first is the Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) which is referred to as the continuity index to the existing National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration-Advanced Very High Resolution Radiometer (NOAA-AVHRR) derived NDVI.  The second vegetation layer is the Enhanced Vegetation Index (EVI), which has improved sensitivity over high biomass regions.  
The grid consists of 4,800 rows and 4,800 columns of 250 meter pixels.  The algorithm chooses the best available pixel value from all the acquisitions from the 16 day period.  The criteria used is low clouds, low view angle and the highest NDVI/EVI value.
Along with the Vegetation layers and the two QA layers the HDF file will have MODIS Reflectance bands 1 (Red), 2 (NIR), 3 (Blue), and 7 (MIR), as well as four observation layers.  Validation at stage 3 has been achieved for all MODIS MOD/MYD13 vegetation products.

Contact.HoursOfService: M-F, 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. Central Time

Address.StreetAddress: U.S. Geological Survey, Earth Resources Observation and Science (EROS) Center

Characteristic.Name: EquatorCrossingTime
Characteristic.Description: Local time of the equator crossing and direction (ascending or descending)

AdditionalAttribute.Name: HORIZONTALTILENUMBER
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Horizontal tile number of a grid, which increases from left to right.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: QAPERCENTGOODQUALITY
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Percent of pixels with good quality

AdditionalAttribute.Name: QAPERCENTNOTPRODUCEDOTHER
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Percent of pixels not produced due to some reason other than cloud

AdditionalAttribute.Name: QAPERCENTOTHERQUALITY
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Percent of pixels with not so good quality

AdditionalAttribute.Name: VERTICALTILENUMBER
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Vertical tile number of a grid, which increases from top to bottom.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: PROCESSVERSION
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Version of the process software that generated the product.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: TileID
AdditionalAttribute.Description: MODIS Land tile identification number which represents a geographical area on the surface of the Earth bounded by latitude and longitude coordinates.

AdditionalAttribute.Name: NDVI250M16DAYQCLASSPERCENTAGE
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Percentage of pixels with best quality in the 16-day 250m NDVI

AdditionalAttribute.Name: EVI250M16DAYQCLASSPERCENTAGE
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Percentage of pixels with best quality in the 16-day 250m EVI

AdditionalAttribute.Name: identifier_product_doi
AdditionalAttribute.Description: Digital object identifier that uniquely identifies this data product

AdditionalAttribute.Name: identifier_product_doi_authority
AdditionalAttribute.Description: URL of the digital object identifier resolving authority

OnlineAccessURL.URLDescription: LP DAAC Data Pool provides direct access to available products via HTTPS.
USGS EarthExplorer provides users the ability to query, search, and order products available from the LP DAAC.
Earthdata Search allows users to search, discover, visualize, refine, and access NASA Earth Observation data.

OnlineResource.Description: The LP DAAC product page provides information on Science Data Set layers and links for user guides, ATBDs, data access, tools, customer support, etc.
The LP DAAC website provides detailed information on discovery, distribution, access, and support of land data products.
OPeNDAP provides direct access to data via HTTPS.
